TextView.android:text: MHT CET or Maharashtra Common Entrance Test is a state-level entrance exam conducted for admission into Engineering and Allied Health Sciences courses in Maharashtra. MHT CET 2019 is scheduled for multiples dates from May 2 to May 13, 2019 in online mode. More than 360 colleges participate in MHT CET. It is one of the most popular state level entrance examinations for which every year lakhs of candidates apply.

MHT CET 2019 Application process
MHT CET 2019 Application process(with a late fee)
Last day to pay MHT CET application fee
Issue of Admit Card
MHT CET Exam date
MHT CET 2019 result

• The candidate should be an Indian citizen to get admission in the year of 2019 in Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering, Mumbai. • The candidate should have passed 10+2 with Physics and Mathematics as the compulsory subjects with one of the Chemistry or Biotechnology or Biology or Technical Vocational subjects and obtained a minimum of 50% marks (at least 45% marks, in the case on backwards class categories and persons with disability for the Maharashtra state domicile only). The candidate should have appeared in the all the subjects in CET and should obtain a non zero score in CET conducted by a competent authority. • For the students not belonging to Maharashtra, JEE-Main exam is also considered and will be given more priority than the CET exam results. OR • The student should have passed Diploma in the Science related subjects from a recognized University.

100 questions - Paper I and Paper II 50 questions - Paper III
No

Candidates need to bring the documents that are given below for verification at the time of counselling. The list of documents is given below:
• Class 10 marksheet and certificate • Class 12 marksheet and certificate • Hall Ticket of MHT CET/IIT MAINS • Transfer Certificate from the institution from which the candidate has passed • Category certificate if applicable • Candidates who have passed their 10+2 or equivalent examination from overseas board/ Universities are required to submit AIU equivalence certificate to confirm the eligibility for the program. • Candidates who have passed, or, are appearing for 10+2 examination from a Board/University where Grade Point Average is given, they would have to produce in writing from the Board/University concerned, the equivalent percentage for the GPA/ CGPA obtained • Passport size photograph
Photo Id Required: One of the id proofs from the list given below has to be taken along with the admit card:
• Voters ID • Passport • School/College ID • Aadhaar Card • Driving License (Learner license will not be accepted) • Admit card of class 12 • PAN Card
